2.text: I see, so you already know.
2.name: Captain Hayes

3.text: I thought it was Bruke when I saw the initials, but the keychain from the camera...
3.name: You

4.text: T.B... it stands for Teddy Bear doesn't it?, the keychain...
4.name: You

5.text: Yes, the keychain... I’m the one behind these fires. I’m getting old, and I needed money for my grandchildren.
5.name: Captain Hayes

6.text: The fire started out as a way to make some extra cash. I set buildings on fire to collect insurance money from companies.
6.name: Captain Hayes

7.text: So, you didn’t know that my house was included?
7.name: You

8.text: No, I had no idea. When I found out, I realized how wrong it was.
8.name: Captain Hayes

9.text: It’s one thing to commit a crime for money, but when it affects innocent lives directly... it’s unforgivable.
9.name: Captain Hayes

10.text: But why keep going, even when you knew the risks?
10.name: You

11.text: I thought I could control it, keep it limited to abandoned buildings. I didn’t realize how far it would go.
11.name: Captain Hayes

12.text: Once I started, it became a way of life, a twisted solution to a desperate situation.
12.name: Captain Hayes

13.text: And now? What are you going to do?
13.name: You

14.text: I’m turning myself in. I know it won’t fix anything, but I have to face the consequences of my actions.
14.name: Captain Hayes

15.text: I’m truly sorry for what I’ve done. I’ll turn myself in and accept whatever comes my way.
15.name: Captain Hayes

16.text: Is there anything else you want to say before we end this?
16.name: You

17.text: Just that I’m sorry. For everything. I should have known better, and I should have stopped before it was too late.
17.name: Captain Hayes
